entries.title: Australian Open: Down under, the most relaxed of Grand Slam tournaments
entries.description: Less exuberant than the US Open but far from the very sedate Wimbledon, the Melbourne tournament, nicknamed the 'Happy Slam', is like a joyful festival.

entries.title: New Caledonia's inner quest to exorcize colonial past and find peaceful future
entries.description: 'New Caledonia, a land on standby' (1/3). While three referendums have rejected independence since 2018, harmony between New Caledonia's pro-independence and loyalist communities remains elusive because of the French archipelago's lingering wounds left by a colonial past.

entries.title: Lula fires Brazilian army chief in aftermath January 8 riots
entries.description: The Brazilian president replaced General Julio Cesar de Arruda by General Tomas Miguel Ribeiro as head of the army.

entries.title: In France, the triple epidemic of Covid-19, flu and bronchiolitis subsides, but tensions remain high in hospitals
entries.description: More than epidemics, the shortage of nurses and care assistants is causing beds to close, putting an even greater burden on France's stretched hospital system.

entries.title: Right-wing parties gather tens of thousands for protest against Spanish government
entries.description: Right-wing and far-right parties are incensed at Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez's decision to aboilsh the crime of sedition.

entries.title: In the European Parliament, suspected Moroccan corruption sparks backlash
entries.description: For the first time in more than 20 years, the European Parliament adopted a text criticizing attacks on freedom of expression in Morocco. The vote comes one month after a corruption scandal involving Rabat.

entries.title: Peru closes famed Machu Picchu tourist site amid protests
entries.description: At least 400 people, including 300 foreigners, are stranded at the foot of the site in the town of Aguas Calientes and pleading to be evacuated.

entries.title: Brazil: The limits of Lula's army 'purge' after the January 8 riots
entries.description: 'All those who took part in pro-coup acts will be punished,' promised the Brazilian president on January 18. But some in his camp think that his sweep doesn't go far enough.

entries.title: Russia says it held training exercise on repelling air attacks in Moscow region
entries.description: The ministry said 150 soldiers took part in the exercises, but the Kremlin refused to say if authorities were preparing for strikes on the capital.

entries.title: 'Madonna, the mayor of Amiens, and the sexy painting'
entries.description: Mayor of Amiens Brigitte Fouré is asking the singer to lend her a painting that she owns, similar to the one that the Picardy town lost during the First World War. Each is playing her part, not without ulterior motives.

entries.title: French Socialists weaker than ever as party congress reveals 50-50 divide
entries.description: Incumbent party leader Olivier Faure and his challenger Nicolas Mayer-Rossignol have both claimed victory after the party's internal election.

entries.title: From Benin to Egypt, China reaffirms commitment to Africa
entries.description: China's new Foreign Minister Qin Gang visited five African countries to strengthen economic and diplomatic ties.

entries.title: French ice skating coach at center of sexual assault scandal dies
entries.description: Gilles Beyer was accused of rape and repeated sexual assaults by former figure skater Sarah Abitbol, in a book she published in 2020.

entries.title: Australian Open: Djokovic defeats Dimitrov to reach last 16, Murray bows out
entries.description: Novak Djokovic reached the last 16 on Saturday, January 21 after defeating Grigor Dimitrov, while Andy Murray's heroic run ended after being beaten by Bautista Agut.

entries.title: 'Navalny is Putin’s personal prisoner'
entries.description: On January 22, a rally will be held in Paris in support of Alexei Navalny and all political prisoners in Russia, organized by Russie Libertés. Lev Ponomarev, the president of the Sakharov Institute, urges Parisians to attend.

entries.title: French investigation into ill-gotten goods from Mubarak-era Egypt era has stalled
entries.description: Twelve years after the fall of Hosni Mubarak, judicial cooperation between Paris and Cairo has fizzled out. This is 'frustrating', say French sources, who fear having to 'start from scratch.'

entries.title: Air defense systems installed on Moscow roofs
entries.description: Pantsir S-1 and S-400 systems have appeared in recent days in the Russian capital, sometimes on top of private buildings.

entries.title: The endless decline of France's Socialists
entries.description: The new crisis of governance shaking the Parti Socialiste risks transforming it into a residual party with no influence.

entries.title: Google becomes latest tech giant to announce massive layoffs, after Microsoft, Meta and Amazon
entries.description: The company will cut 12,000 jobs. Since 2022, 1,150 tech companies have cut more than 190,000 jobs, a sharp correction after the hiring frenzy during the Covid-19 pandemic.

entries.title: Defense Minister Lecornu: 'This military budget allows France to remain a world power'
entries.description: French Defense Minister Sébastien Lecornu details the future military programming law, which plans France's military expenses for the next seven years.

entries.title: Russia to retaliate after France freezes RT accounts, report media
entries.description: RT France, which was previously banned from broadcasting in France, saw its assets frozen on Friday.

entries.title: Germany still reluctant to supply battle tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: Berlin said that 'no decisio' has been made on the subject after the eighth meeting of Kyiv's allies, on Friday in Ramstein, Germany.

entries.title: Macron promises leap in military spending, but with drastic choices
entries.description: 'We must be one war ahead,' said French president Emmanuel Macron, in a speech on the military. Total military spending in the next seven years will be €413 billion, according to his new plan.

entries.title: Burkina Faso says 66 women, children freed from extremists by army
entries.description: According to state television, the country's armed forces located the hostages, including 39 children, during a military operation in the Center-North region.

entries.title: Turkey cancels Swedish defense minister visit over far-right protest permit
entries.description: The country was angered that Rasmus Paludan, a far-right Swedish-Danish politician who promised to burn a Quran, obtained permission to stage a demonstration in front of its embassy in Stockholm.

entries.title: In Belgium, a football hooligan explains the allure of 'free-fighting'
entries.description: Despite the efforts of law enforcement and the justice system, the issue of violent 'free fights' between football hooligans remains a major concern.

entries.title: Births at their lowest and life expectancy stagnating: French population hit by Covid-19
entries.description: The natural balance reached its lowest level in 2022. The French population reached 68 million inhabitants on January 1, 2023, up 0.3%.

entries.title: Fertility: Why France remains a model in Europe
entries.description: While it's difficult to measure the impact of family support policies on the country's high fertility rate, researchers found that the European countries where the most children are born are those where it's easiest to balance motherhood and a career.

entries.title: One-in-five new cars sold in California in 2022 was zero-emission
entries.description: The largest car market in the United States charges towards its goal of electrifying its fleet. Ten years ago, that figure was 2 percent.

entries.title: In Sweden, Renewcell wants to revolutionize fashion
entries.description: Inspired by the wood industry, the company launched a textile recycling plant to transform old clothes into cellulose fiber.

entries.title: Australian Open: Medvedev is out but Swiatek charges on
entries.description: With Carlos Alcaraz absent because of injury, Daniil Medvedev's surprise defeat to the 29th seed is another boost to Novak Djokovic. In the women's draw, Greek sixth seed Maria Sakkari is out, and Iga Swiatek is chasing a first Australian Open title.

entries.title: Industrial tourism: Five astonishing places to visit in France
entries.description: Whether technological flagships or the last representatives of a creative art, factories throughout France are opening their doors to visitors.

entries.title: In Senegal, anger at Marine Le Pen's visit: 'Her conscience should keep her from stepping on African soil'
entries.description: This trip by the leader of the Rassemblement National (RN) aroused the anger of local politicians and civil society actors.

entries.title: US Treasure Secretary warns of possible recession and "global financial crisis" if the US defaults on payments
entries.description: Janet Yellen's comments on CNN come as the US Treasury started taking 'extraordinary measures' this week to avert a default as Congress heads toward a clash over raising the debt limit.

entries.title: Lima 'stormed' by protesters in Peru
entries.description: The demonstrators from the Andes flocked to the capital to demand the president's resignation.
